DOC.HEAD: Ex-Oil Executives Charged in Sham Trades
DOC.TEXT: Two former executives of the Enron Oil Corp. were charged Wednesday with conspiring to defraud the company through a series of phony oil trading transactions. The defendants were charged in federal court in White Plains, N.Y., a New York suburb. They agreed to plead guilty at a later date, said U.S. Attorney Otto Obermaier. The former Enron executives are Louis Borget, who was the president and chief executive officer, and Thomas Mastroeni, the vice president and secretary-treasurer. The alleged phony transactions took place in 1985 and 1986 before both men left Enron Oil, a subsidiary of the Houston-based Enron Corp., in 1987. Enron Oil Corp. is located in the Westchester County community of Valhalla.
